title: Representations - Interpret Behavior of Accum Func

content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, the integral from negative 4 to x, of, open parenthesis, the fraction t squared over 6, end fraction, minus 2 times the sine of, open parenthesis, e to the t power, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. How many relative extrema does <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have on the open interval <math alttext="negative 4 less than x, less than 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
